title: False positive of unreachable code in tuple expressions with side effects

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=76486608937476e12acbe18e86436b74

```rust
fn main() {
    (println!("Work"), return).1
}
```

The current output is:

```
warning: unreachable expression
 --> src/main.rs:2:5
  |
2 |     (println!("Work"), return).1
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^------^
  |     |                  |
  |     |                  any code following this expression is unreachable
  |     unreachable expression
  |
  = note: `#[warn(unreachable_code)]` on by default

warning: `playground` (bin "playground") generated 1 warning
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 2.26s
     Running `target/debug/playground`
```

Since the side effect is actually performed (`Work` in stdout), the warning is not appropriate here.
